Ensure to split the expressions and assignments into multiple lines for better readability and maintainability.
Avoid having  a method call or additional expressions in a statement using "++" or "--" operators (C/C++)
Avoid using Digraphs (C++)
Avoid using Trigraphs
Avoid using Unions
All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit.
Avoid declaring data members in non-POD classes as public or protected
A base class shall be declared virtual only if it is used in a diamond hierarchy
Ensure to use C++ style notation casts to avoid unexpected type conversions
Handlers of a function-try-block implementation of a class constructor ordestructor shall not reference non-static members from this class or its bases.
Ensure that you do not convert a function pointer to any other type to avoid unexpected behavior
Ensure that pointer types are not cast to integral types
Member functions shall not return non-const handles to class-data.
Ensure that you use 'enum' types with  [ ], =, == and !=, the unary & operator, and <, <=, >, >=.
Ensure to have boolean operands with boolean operators
Avoid having expressions with bool type to be used as operands on operators other than =, &&, ||, !, ==, !=, the unary & operator, and the conditional operator
Avoid dynamic_cast to convert current object to its derived class from its constructor or destructor
Avoid delete operators to exit with an exception.
Avoid move constructor and move assignment operator to exit with an exception
Avoid checking Integer overflow without explicit cast
Converting a multiplication to a larger type should be done before the multiplication takes place
Avoid comparing types of different widths in a loop
Bit-fields shall be either unsigned integral, or enumeration (with underlying type of unsigned integral type).
Ensure arrays and containers are accessed using unsigned values
Avoid lines starting with "#" with invalid pre-processing directive
Undefined macro identifiers shall not be used in #if or #elif preprocessor directives, except as operands to the defined operator
Arguments to a function-like macro shall not contain tokens that look like preprocessing directives.
Avoid using # OR ## operators more than once while defining macros
Prefer defining macros in Global Namespace
Avoid using goto to jump backwards into a statement in the same function(C/C++)
Mke sure you do not have unused labels in your code
Avoid defining, redefining or undefining standard macros from standard library
Avoid using typeid in polymorphic class from the body of its constructor or destructor.
Prefer using a Join with a consition when making SQL queries so that performance is not adversely impacted due to cartesian/cross join
Prefer using a Join with a consition when making SQL queries on XXL tables so that performance is not adversely impacted due to cartesian/cross join
Ensure to include index in your SQL table so that performance of your app is not adversely impacted
Ensure to include index in your SQL XXL tables so that performance of your app is not adversely impacted
Make sure you use SARGable predicate in WHERE clauses and JOINS to prevent additional costs on CPU
Prefer using INNER JOINS instead of NATURAL JOINS for better performance
While using ORDER BY in queries prefer using Column names instead of indexes for better maintainability and readability of queries in code
Try to separate JOIN and WHERE clauses by following ANSI-Standard joins format to improve maintainability and readabitliy
Ensure that you have a limited number of paramenters in OR clauses or IN statements to ensure good query performance
Prefer not using GROUP BY clauses in queries as it hampers the performance and is inefficient
Make sure the identifiers defined in SQL are not quoted <""> as it is confusing to read and reduces maintainability of code
Make sure to define Primary Key (PK) for your tables to enforce row integrity of data
To ensure query performance make sure you do not use Dynamic SQL, specially for modules that are called too often
When inserting data into columns always define column names to prevent mistakes and wrong updates
Always use MINUS or EXCEPT operator instead of NOT EXISTS and NOT IN subqueries for better execution performance
Ensure that you are not making queries and Joins on too many tables or views as it hampers execution performance
When using EXISTS or NOT EXISTS clauses make sure that you refer to parent object and not  independent clauses to ensure better performance
Prefer replacing DISTINCT in your queries with a WHERE, FROM clause that fetches only the required data
Ensure using ANSI standard Operators such as <>,<=,>= in SQL where clauses to ensure portability
To improve the readability of your SQL statements use IN test condition instead of multiple OR conditions on same identifier
Ensure to handle exception in a catch block and not leave it empty
Prefer not having table names using characters outside of [a-z,0-9,_] for better readability and changeability
Prefer not having view names using characters outside of [a-z,0-9,_] for better readability and changeability
Ensure to have your packages named based on the same naming convention for better readability
Ensure to have your package functions named based on the same naming convention for better readability
Ensure to have your package stored procedures named based on the same naming convention for better readability
Ensure to use WHEN OTHERS with WHEN for exception handling to prevent unexpected behavior
Ensure to propagate errors to client instead of using with NULL when handling exceptions through WHEN OTHERS
Ensure that your tables do not have large number of columns as it tends to add redundancy in data, try dividing the tables instead and link them through keys
Prefer to use a similar syntax for JOIN in same SQL queries and not mix ANSI and non-ANSI syntax
When using LIKE operator make sure the first character in search string is not a wildcard character as it reduces execution performance
Ensure to use one SQL statement per line to enhance readability and maintainability of query statements
Ensure that you do not have triggers acting on other triggers and cascading, review your design to avoid such cases
Ensure that when using triangular joins you restrict the results with some extra conditions to avoid severe performance issues
Make sure you don't have synonyms with both private and public definitions to avoid complexity, try renaming one of them instead
Always use 'IS NULL' or 'IS NOT NULL' to check for Nullability instead of using '=' or '!=' operators
Improve the readability and maintainability of your queries by using aliases for tables
Ensure your table aliases do not have numbers to improve readability
Ensure column references in queries are qualified to avoid any ambiguous and undefined references
Ensure that when creating synonyms you define them as PRIVATE and not PUBLIC
When creating synonyms ensure that you do not reference a missing object as it will create errors at execution
Ensure that when chaining synonyms you do not loop them leading to synonym referring to itself as it will cause a error during execution
Ensure using a set-oriented approach instead of using a iterative approach caused by using cursors inside loops for better performance of queries
Ensure to use VARCHAR2 or NVARCHAR2 instead of CHAR, VARCHAR or NCHAR as the latter will be deprecated and uses more disk space
Ensure that you use CLOB, NCLOB or BLOB datatypes in tables instead of LONG or LONG RAW as the latter are deprecated
Each table should have a clustered index
Errors should be handled in stored procedures and functions
Stored Procedures should always RETURN a status value. RETURN 0 to indicate success and any non-zero value indicates failure.

Avoid Artifacts with a Complex SELECT Clause (SQL)
Avoid Functions and Procedures doing an Insert, Update or Delete without managing a transaction (SQL)
LIKE conditions should not be used without wildcards characters
XXL Tables should have a primary key / unique key constraint / unique index
Tables should have a primary key / unique key constraint / unique index
Ensure to not use explain() method in production code so that performance is not reduced
Avoid having multiple Artifacts updating data on the same NoSQL Collection (JEE)
Avoid having multiple Artifacts inserting data on the same NoSQL Collection (JEE)
Avoid having multiple artifacts deleting data on the same NoSQL collections (JEE)
Avoid artifacts having db.collection.ensureIndex() to create new indexes
When using compound indexes, avoid having different index ordering in collection access

Avoid having multiple Artifacts inserting data on the same NoSQL Collection
Avoid having multiple artifacts deleting data on the same NoSQL collection
